content.content: [Ratification Poll for Amend MIP61 to tighten up Recognized Delegate Participation Metrics (MIP4c2-SP29) - January 9, 2023] (Maker Governance - Ratification Poll for Amend MIP61 to tighten up Recognized Delegate Participation Metrics (MIP4c2-SP29) - January 9, 2023) (MIP4c2-SP29: Amend MIP61 to tighten up Recognized Delegate Participation Metrics) Voted: 1st choice: Approve both 2nd choice: Approve only the Higher Participation Requirements and Weighting for Executive Votes 3rd choice: Approve only the Abstain Modifier Reasoning: We support both amendments to the delegate compensation framework. However, we note that voting Abstain is often a valid choice if, for example, delegates disagree with both options. We believe 40% is a generous enough filter to ensure that valid use of the Abstain vote is allowed while discouraging lack of participation by delegates. Of course, delegation is also voluntary, so token holders can decide to support or not support delegates with a history of abstaining from votes. [Ratification Poll for Amend MIP51 to Remove MIP51c4 (Calendar Exceptions) (MIP4c2-SP28) - January 9, 2023] (Maker Governance - Ratification Poll for Amend MIP51 to Remove MIP51c4 (Calendar Exceptions) (MIP4c2-SP28) - January 9, 2023) (MIP4c2-SP28: Amend MIP51 to remove MIP51c4: Calendar Exceptions) Voted: Yes Reasoning: The governance process at MakerDAO is comprehensive and intense, and the break in December in light of the holiday seasons across different cultures and time zones is more than welcome. However, we agree that 1 month of no activity is excessive, given this break acts to delay rather than reduce the burden of governance participants. Therefore, we are voting yes to removing calendar exceptions with a view to reintroducing this as a reduced break of say one or two weeks, should other delegates agree. [Ratification Poll for MIP14 Repeal (MIP4c4-SP2) - January 9, 2023] (Maker Governance - Ratification Poll for MIP14 Repeal (MIP4c4-SP2) - January 9, 2023) (MIP4c4-SP2: MIP14 Repeal) Voted: No Reasoning: During this transition / unwinding phase, many legacy CUs are asking for continued funding for operations via SPFs, under MIP-55. We understand that MIP14 serves as a fallback mechanism to disburse funding in the event the requested funds fall outside of the scope of MIP-55. This goes into hypotheticals as we understand MIP-14 has not been used for CU funding in the past, but during this uncertain period we prefer to have maximum flexibility and so are voting against repealing this MIP. [Ratification Poll for Obsolete MIP Removal (MIP23, MIP28) (MIP4c4-SP3) - January 9, 2023] (Maker Governance - Ratification Poll for Obsolete MIP Removal (MIP23, MIP28) (MIP4c4-SP3) - January 9, 2023) (MIP4c4-SP3: Obsolete MIP Removal (MIP23, MIP28)) Voted: Yes Reasoning: We support this proposal to remove long obsolete MIPs that were put into place before the Core Unit system. [Ratification Poll for Remove MIP14c4 (Protocol DAI Transfer Ceiling) (MIP4c2-SP32) - January 9, 2023] (Maker Governance - Ratification Poll for Remove MIP14c4 (Protocol DAI Transfer Ceiling) (MIP4c2-SP32) - January 9, 2023) (MIP4c2-SP32: Remove MIP14c4: Protocol DAI Transfer Ceiling) Voted: Yes Reasoning: We support this proposal to remove the arbitrary cap put into place on the SPF mechanism under MIP-55 given the expanded need for funding via this mechanism during Maker’s transition / unwinding phase. [Ratification Poll for Core Unit Offboarding (COM-001) (MIP39c3-SP7) - January 9, 2023] (Maker Governance - Ratification Poll for Core Unit Offboarding (COM-001) (MIP39c3-SP7) - January 9, 2023) (MIP39c3-SP7: Core Unit Offboarding (COM-001)) Voted: 1st choice: Approve Offboarding, 60,700 DAI Golden Parachute and 100% Multiplier for retroactive MKR - additional 107,317.50 DAI (CU-preferred) Reasoning: We understand that with the Endgame plan, the governance function is being consolidated toward GovAlpha, with potential re-employment of the GovComms team under a new cluster / function / MetaDAO in the Endgame structure. Before that happens, GovComms are seeking retroactive payment for MKR earned and vested, as well as a Golden Parachute payment as per offboarding of other CUs. As GovComms has provided valuable services to Maker and David is clearly a respected and valued member of the community, we are voting for a full payout of all retroactively earned MKR. [Ratification Poll for Requesting Protocol DAI Transfer to fund TechOps CU for February 2023 (MIP14c2-SP1) - January 9, 2023] (Maker Governance - Ratification Poll for Requesting Protocol DAI Transfer to fund TechOps CU for February 2023 (MIP14c2-SP1) - January 9, 2023) (MIP14c2-SP1: Requesting Protocol DAI Transfer to fund TechOps CU for February 2023) Voted: Yes Reasoning: We support TechOps CU to continue developing and operating the Maker system. Before the revised budget plan rolling out on March, it is rational to allocate funds under the NewBase to the CU only for February 2023. [Ratification Poll for Protocol DAI Transfer to Fund IS-001 from Dec 2022 to May 2023 (MIP14c2-SP2) - January 9, 2023] (Maker Governance - Ratification Poll for Protocol DAI Transfer to Fund IS-001 from Dec 2022 to May 2023 (MIP14c2-SP2) - January 9, 2023) (MIP14c2-SP2: Subproposal for Protocol DAI Transfer to Fund ISCU from Dec 2022 to May 2023) Voted: Yes Reasoning: After the last budget proposal of ISCU got rejected, ISCU needs funds to keep their work during the off-boarding process. The security of smart contracts is crucial for Maker and we support taking needed funds from their current account surplus. [Ratification Poll for Commercial Risk and Legal Domain Work to Support SF-001 Expanded Mandate Related to RWAs (MIP55c3-SP12) - January 9, 2023] (Maker Governance - Ratification Poll for Commercial Risk and Legal Domain Work to Support SF-001 Expanded Mandate Related to RWAs (MIP55c3-SP12) - January 9, 2023) (MIP55c3-SP12: Commercial Risk and Legal Domain Work to Support SF-001 Expanded Mandate Related to RWAs) Voted: Yes Reasoning: It remains crucial for Maker to continue monitoring the RWA assets during this transition / unwinding period and the proposed budget allocation appears reasonable in light of other SPF requests and the expanded mandate of this team. We also note @roo has done a good job of publishing RWA reports every month and support his continued work here. [Ratification Poll for Special Purpose Fund for developing Proof-of-Performance for Viridian Cluster (MIP55c3-SP13) - January 9, 2023] (Maker Governance - Ratification Poll for Special Purpose Fund for developing Proof-of-Performance for Viridian Cluster (MIP55c3-SP13) - January 9, 2023) (MIP55c3-SP13 : Special Purpose Fund for developing Proof-of-Performance for Viridian Cluster) Voted: No Reasoning: There is currently a lack of clarity regarding how Maker functions should continue to be funded via SPFs during this transition / unwinding period. We support funding of necessary activities, however this particular proposal is confusing to us given the overlap in team, mandate and sources of funding between legacy CUs, new MetaDAO clusters, and requesters of SPFs. Given the clusters are not finalised it also seems premature to be allocating what is effectively a temporary budget to that cluster. The use of funds for this SPF is unclear and could benefit from greater specificity. In particular, it’s not clear what the funding will be used for besides compensation, given the projects are already live and monitoring would fall under the scope of the original funding already disbursed for these projects. The amount requested also seems very high in context of the financial position of the DAO. [Ratification Poll for Onboard-Amend Keeper Network - Chainlink Automation (MIP63c4-SP5) - January 9, 2023] (Maker Governance - Ratification Poll for Onboard-Amend Keeper Network - Chainlink Automation (MIP63c4-SP5) - January 9, 2023) (MIP63c4-SP5: Onboard/Amend Keeper Network - Chainlink Automation) Voted: Yes Reasoning: We welcome the addition of Chainlink to Maker’s third party keeper network to further secure the protocol. [Ratification Poll for Declaration of Intent to Develop a Comprehensive On-chain Monitoring Solution for RWA Vaults (MIP13c3-SP13) - January 9, 2023] (Maker Governance - Ratification Poll for Declaration of Intent to Develop a Comprehensive On-chain Monitoring Solution for RWA Vaults (MIP13c3-SP13) - January 9, 2023) (MIP13c3-SP13: Declaration of Intent to Develop a Comprehensive On-chain Monitoring Solution for RWA Vaults) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Given Maker’s diversification into RWA it is sensible to implement some form of on-chain monitoring for RWA vaults. Given this is an open call for external solutions provider and does not involve an allocation of budget at this stage, we are open to receiving proposals to consider options down the line. [Ratification Poll for Onboard PSM USDC to Yearn to earn Yield (MIP92) - January 9, 2023] (Maker Governance - Ratification Poll for Onboard PSM USDC to Yearn to earn Yield (MIP92) - January 9, 2023) (MIP92: Onboard PSM USDC to Yearn to earn Yield) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Amidst declining QoQ revenues for Maker, we support a new revenue stream of $2m / year for Maker on a Yearn vault specifically designed for our protocol. We also support diversifying sources of yield to include both centralised / RWA and on-chain yield. However, the technical implementation handover will have to be carefully managed to ensure continuation as CUs are being wound down. [Ratification Poll for Defense Fund (MIP55c3-SP14) - January 9, 2023] (Maker Governance - Ratification Poll for Defense Fund (MIP55c3-SP14) - January 9, 2023) (MIP55c3-SP14: Defense Fund) Voted: No Reasoning: The need to pre-empt these funds for future legal action is not quite clear and as such we are voting no on this proposal. If a specific legal liability materialises in the future, we would support allocation of emergency funding to combat that liability, but this proposal seems unnecessary to us at this stage given it lacks a specific claim. [Ratification Poll for MIP63 Maker Keeper Network Amendment (MIP4c2-SP31) - January 9, 2023] (Maker Governance - Ratification Poll for MIP63 Maker Keeper Network Amendment (MIP4c2-SP31) - January 9, 2023) (MIP4c2-SP31: MIP63 Maker Keeper Network Amendment) Voted: Yes Reasoning: We support passage of this uncontroversial set of amendments to incorporate learnings from the beta phase of the programme.

We believe this is going to be an important move of seizing more users inflow and securing the position in the DeFi market. Offboarding Parameters for USDC-A, USDP-A, and GUSD-A - January 23, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: In line with the previous poll regarding reducing bad debt this poll finalizes Maker’s debt position and would supplement the PSM with additional funding particularly for USDC-A.

content.content: Ratification Poll - Declaration of Intent - Implement a Feature to Refund People who Lost Money Sending Dai to the Dai Contract Address (MIP13c3-SP14) - February 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: The proposal is more like a draft of an idea without concrete analysis and design. Given Maker is currently under Endgame rewinding process and focus on RWA clients, there is no need to digress and put extra efforts on designing a refund mechanism - maybe could insert additional warning when making DAI transfer instead. Ratification Poll for Amend MIP62 to Allow for Changing Communication Responsibilities (MIP4c2-SP33) - February 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: We welcome the continuous modification of existing MIPs to enhance protocol functionality and customer satisfaction. As such it makes sense to streamline the communication process in the event of a collateral offboarding. Ratification Poll for Amend Interim Facilitator Appointment Process (MIP4c2-SP30) - February 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: We agree with this proposal to limit the number of interim facilitators to one and help streamline responsibilities and incentives. The caps on term length ensure that interim facilitators don’t become permanent, and majority approval helps to moderate the selection process. Ratification Poll for $100M of Cogent Bank Loan Participations (MIP95) - February 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: We support this proposal to onboard Cogent Bank. We see it as a relatively low-effort way to onboard additional real world lending and bring further RWA revenue streams to Maker (currently the main source of income for the protocol). We understand the deal will be structured on same terms as the HVB deal previously approved and positively received by the community. The underlying assets are moderate risk, short-duration loans originators by Cogent, a FDIC-regulated community bank, to borrowers in the Southwest US community. Supporting small businesses and homeowners with funds originated through DeFi is a welcome narrative and could bring credibility to Maker and the wider DeFi space. Given the ability to reuse existing legal structures and the commitment by Cogent and MaxStability to cover certain legal costs, we see this as a relatively plug and play deal. One factor to consider is that, unlikely prior RWA deals, there is no way to quickly liquidate the loan portfolio should Maker wish to reduce its exposure to the underlying assets (i.e. Cogent has no obligation to repurchase from Maker). In practice this is not likely to be a material issue given the underlying loans are short duration, but it may be prudent to assess potential venues where these loans could be sold should the need arise.

content.content: Short Ratification Poll for Vault Setting Amendment Subproposal (MIP92c5-SP1) - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Compared to the large amount of USDC in PSM, the $3m limitation means the exposure to Yearn is not significant. With the current average APY on USDC of 2.7%, the return generated from DeFi farming should also be trivial. Therefore, we take this proposal as an attempt of boosting capital efficiency of PSM assets, exploring diversified revenue on DeFi space, and building a beneficial relationship with Yearn. In light of the approval of MIP92, we support Maker CUs to start working on the implementation of the bespoke Yearn Vaults. Additionally, though there was a USDC de-peg crisis a few days ago, we regard the alarm has been cleared as USDC has rebuilt its peg and SVB saved by Fed - PSM flow will likely stabilize soon. Return Excess MIP65 Funds to Surplus Buffer - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: As previously discussed in the Maker community, RWA vaults should return the surplus to Maker Surplus Buffer. This helps Maker receive revenue from RWA exposure and build confidence about future investment. Increase the MIP65 (RWA007-A) Debt Ceiling - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: As USDC has now repegged risk has decreased it makes sense to pursue this to increase RWA revenue generation.
